page.title: 06INDUSTRIAL DECLINE 4
page.content: A lttle further up, still opposite the pool, are the New Row Cottages. They were built about 1830, and have been known locally as 'Upper Row' cottages. Again they were built by the Coal- brookdale Co., for the "principal workmen" and were generally regarded as 'better class' cottages. The most famous resident of the Old Row, living at number 6, was William Ball. He is synonomous with 'John Bull'. In the mid-nineteenth century, he worked as a puddler for the Coal- brookdale Co. for 40 years and was a man of enormous proportions. He weighed over 40 stones, but was only 5'-9" high, yet his chest measured 70" and his stomach 80", whilst his neck had a circumference of 23". His house is currently lived in by a man from Walsall, who has been here 18 months.
